title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
00:21 <Mariah> has joined #xwiki  
00:21 <Mariah> hello again  
00:21 <Mariah> somebody knows how hide attachments?  
00:28 <fmancinelli> has quit  
00:30 <Mariah> hellooooo  
00:38 <abusenius> has quit  
00:43 <Mariah> has quit  
00:48 <polx> has quit  
01:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
01:44 <UCC> has quit  
03:02 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:54 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:26 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:38 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
09:04 <sburjan> vmassol: going to re-test your fix from yesterday on Postgres and Oracle  
09:04 <vmassol> ok great  
09:05 <sburjan> it's just that I don't see any snapshot from today  
09:06 <sburjan> it's from 15:43 .. does it contain your fix ?  
09:07 <sburjan> (vmassol)  
09:09 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <vmassol> sburjan: check when you I told I had fixed it  
09:10 <vmassol> in the irc history  
09:10 <vmassol> and then go to ci.xwiki.org and check the build timestamps  
09:10 <vmassol> (that's what I would have to do to answer your question ;))  
09:10 <vmassol> or build it locally  
09:11 <vmassol> (you can just build enterprise probably)  
09:12 <vmassol> we need to fix the build though  
09:12 <vmassol> it's a pain that it's never working  
09:12 <vmassol> :(  
09:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's still "[ERROR] com.xpn.xwiki.store.XWikiHibernateBaseStore: Method 'protected java.lang.String[] addHibernateSequenceIfRequired(java.lang.String[], java.lang.String, org.hibernate.Session)' has been removed"  
09:12 <vmassol> ah fialing because of me  
09:12 <vmassol> fixing  
09:14 <sburjan> vmassol: I see you close the JIRA ticket at 11:46, and the latest snapshot is from 15:43, so I will presume that it contains your fix. The thing is that I don't know if the time from the server is properly set, this is why I am always confused  
09:15 <vmassol> sburjan: I'd avise that you build it  
09:15 <vmassol> since it hasn'tbeen built since a long time  
09:15 <vmassol> and we committed a lots of stuff yesterday  
09:15 <vmassol> so you'll miss them and thus not test them  
09:15 <sburjan> yes  
09:15 <vmassol> but  
09:15 <sburjan> but if it fails on CI, it will fail locally also, right ?  
09:15 <vmassol> see above  
09:15 <vmassol> message from thomas  
09:15 <sburjan> exactly  
09:16 <vmassol> hint: don't run clirr  
09:17 <sburjan> any tutorial on how to build enterprise ?  
09:17 <vmassol> !search building  
09:17 <sburjan> thanks  
09:17 <sburjan> I'll try building locally then  
09:18 <vmassol> it won't help you  
09:18 <vmassol> as mentioned above  
09:18 <vmassol> platform is failing  
09:18 <vmassol> not enterprise  
09:18 <sburjan> ok, then I'll wait for you to fix it :)  
09:19 <vmassol> well that'll be too long so  
09:19 <vmassol> you should still test my fix only with the built snapshot  
09:19 <vmassol> but you'll need to retest other stuff with a newer build later on  
09:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you change this:  
09:22 <vmassol> [ERROR] com.xpn.xwiki.tool.backup.Importer: Return type of method 'public void importXAR(java.io.File, java.lang.String, com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiContext)' has been changed to int  
09:22 <vmassol> ?  
09:23 <mflorea> vmassol: I added it in the CLIRR report, but it hasn't been excluded  
09:23 <mflorea> in the release notes  
09:23 <vmassol> it's failing the build now that I fixed my issue  
09:23 <mflorea> it fails just the clir build  
09:24 <mflorea> not the normal nuild  
09:24 <vmassol> ?  
09:24 <vmassol> wdym?  
09:24 <mflorea> mvn clean install is fine  
09:24 <vmassol> the normal build doesn't execute clirr:check?  
09:24 <mflorea> this change was made before M1  
09:24 <mflorea> on tools no, I don't think  
09:24 <vmassol> do you know why it's different?  
09:24 <vmassol> that's soemthing to fix  
09:25 <vmassol> checking why  
09:33 <vmassol> ok that's easy to understand  
09:34 <vmassol> it's because we don't call clirr on platform tools at all, which is ok I think  
09:34 <mflorea> we don't consider them an API I guess  
09:34 <vmassol> yep  
09:34 <vmassol> they're considered internal tools ATM  
09:34 <vmassol> jsut for our usage  
09:35 <vmassol> now I still need to understand why clirr runs when I type mvn clirr:check there  
09:35 <vmassol> ok got it  
09:36 <vmassol> skip is false by default, I'll put it to true  
09:37 <vmassol> fixed :)  
09:43 <vmassol> guys, we should fix our ci jobs today so that we're ready to release on monday  
09:43 <vmassol> btw tmortagne what's your status for the RC1 release?  
09:43 <mflorea> I fixed webstandards and I'm debugging the rest test failures now  
09:44 <vmassol> sburjan/msmeria: maje sure you test thomas' nex export (see release notes)  
09:44 <vmassol> \*make  
09:44 <vmassol> \*new  
09:44 <tmortagne> lets say ready considering that import will be missing I guess, better concentrate on the release than rushing it  
09:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: so no import?  
09:44 <sburjan> vmassol: as soon there is a newer snapshot on maven.xwiki.org  
09:44 <tmortagne> too short for import yes I think  
09:45 <tmortagne> won't take me too long but more than 1 day so too short for 5.2 I guess  
09:47 <tmortagne> sburjan: don't forget that you need to enable the new export engine (see release note)  
09:48 <vmassol> if it's 2 days it might fit :)  
09:48 <sburjan> tmortagne: ping me when you're finished with it so I can test it  
09:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: you still have a few days  
09:49 <tmortagne> release is on monday  
09:49 <vmassol> for RC1 yes  
09:49 <vmassol> for the final it's next week  
09:49 <tmortagne> putting a new feature after RC1 is not very nice  
09:49 <vmassol> it's not indeed  
09:49 <vmassol> but if you'e not touching anything existing maybe we could allow it  
09:50 <tmortagne> 1 week is perfectly enough but not sure we want it  
09:50 <vmassol> or we could postpone the RC1 by a few days  
09:50 <vmassol> depends how much you nee  
09:50 <vmassol> need  
09:50 <vmassol> if it's 2 days of delay it's ok I think  
09:50 <vmassol> (ie  3 business ddays from now)  
09:50 <tmortagne> 1 week is enough but not 100% sure how much I need, probably better to not postpone the RC1  
09:50 <tmortagne> if it's ok to put t after RC1 I can do it I think  
09:51 <tmortagne> it would be disabled by default like export anyway so I guess it's safe enough  
09:51 <vmassol> in any case you need to work on it even after RC1 whether it's included or not right?  
09:51 <vmassol> so we can keep the same schedule and decide at the last moment  
09:52 <tmortagne> that's what is in the top of my TODO list anyway yes  
09:52 <vmassol> (if you do it on a branch or keep it not pushed)  
09:52 <vmassol> or  
09:52 <tmortagne> we are suposed to create a branch for 5.2 during RC1 release anyway  
09:52 <vmassol> we branch now  
09:52 <vmassol> yep  
09:52 <vmassol> :)  
09:52 <vmassol> (now = RC1)  
09:53 <vmassol> so we could decide on the merge from master to the 5.2 branch at the last moment  
09:53 <tmortagne> we could  
09:56 <vmassol> hmm mvn clirr:check -Plegacy,integration-tests fails on platform  
09:56 <vmassol> [INFO] XWiki Platform - Legacy - Old Core ................ FAILURE [17.697s]  
09:56 <vmassol> [ERROR] org.w3c.tidy.TidyMessageListener not found.  
09:57 <tmortagne> that's weird, we are not supposed to package that  
09:57 <mflorea> vmassol: it has been moved and added to clirr  
09:57 <vmassol> wdym?  
09:57 <tmortagne> we were having this class in our sources ?  
09:58 <mflorea> ah, I though of something else  
09:59 <mflorea> oldcore is not using jtidy any more, only platform-feed is still using it  
10:00 <tmortagne> but CLIRR should not complain about dependencies, should it ?  
10:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <mflorea> I run clirr twice for M1 and M2 since I removed the dependency to jtidy and I didn't got any complains about missing dep  
10:01 <vmassol> you ran on legacy?  
10:02 <mflorea> I ran on all platform  
10:02 <mflorea> with legacy profile on  
10:02 <mflorea> like documented in the release process  
10:02 <vmassol> ok then you should get it, you can try it locally  
10:02 <mflorea> I did it locally :)  
10:02 <vmassol> you have it too?  
10:03 <mflorea> I didn't have it one week ago  
10:04 <vmassol> indeed no jtidy dep  
10:04 <vmassol> checking where it's used  
10:04 <mflorea> platform-feed  
10:05 <vmassol> yes but  
10:06 <vmassol> so it means that the aspectj plugin doesn't bring transitivie deps?  
10:06 <vmassol> that would be strange  
10:07 <tmortagne> what this has to do with aspectj ?  
10:07 <tmortagne> why would be embed jtidy in oldcore-legacy ?  
10:07 <tmortagne> s/be/we/  
10:07 <vmassol> indeed  
10:07 <tmortagne> the only issue for me is why the hell CLIRR complain about a dependency  
10:08 <vmassol> becuase it finds it somewherein our code  
10:08 <tmortagne> this is an issue then  
10:08 <vmassol> checking why  
10:08 <vmassol> or maybe in the old code from 5.1  
10:08 <tmortagne> I don't see why would would have this class in olcore  
10:34 <vmassol> ok so the reason is because clirr needs to analyze both the current classes and the ones from 5.1  
10:34 <vmassol> and in 5.1 TidyMessageLogger was in oldcore  
10:35 <vmassol> so we need to add the jtidy dep in legacy-oldcore for now  
10:35 <vmassol> I'll do that  
10:35 <vmassol> but just for clirr  
10:35 <tmortagne> if TidyMessageLogger was in olcore all you can do is exclude it  
10:35 <tmortagne> CLIRR is not supposed to look at dependencies  
10:35 <vmassol> yeah I guess I can also do that  
10:35 <vmassol> it doesn't look at dependencies  
10:35 <tmortagne> it's the best IMO  
10:35 <vmassol> this is not a dep  
10:36 <tmortagne> "(10:35:00 AM) vmassol: so we need to add the jtidy dep in legacy-oldcore for now"  
10:36 <vmassol> this is maven  
10:36 <vmassol> not clirr  
10:36 <tmortagne> and ?  
10:36 <vmassol> actualyl this is java  
10:36 <vmassol> not even maven  
10:36 <tmortagne> all I'm saying is that i'ts useless  
10:36 <vmassol> to load a class you need its definition  
10:36 <vmassol> yes I agree  
10:36 <tmortagne> it's not because you add jtidy as dependency that you will fix the CIRR error  
10:37 <vmassol> it's already exclued in clirr  
10:37 <vmassol> that's not the issue  
10:37 <tmortagne> if it's excluded it should not complain I don't understand  
10:37 <vmassol> anyway fixing  
10:46 <vmassol> fixed! :)  
11:04 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <mflorea> has quit  
12:59 <vmassol> evalica: there's a broken link in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Junco+Skin#HPrerequisites26InstallationInstructions fyi  
13:00 <evalica> thank you vmassol  
13:02 <vmassol> "This means that every theme fully supports just one ColorTheme that needs to be provided by the developer."  
13:02 <vmassol> do you mean "...every Junco theme fully..."  
13:02 <vmassol> ?  
13:02 <vmassol> (a bit lost with all those theme names ;))  
13:03 <evalica> I mean a Theme will support just on ColorTheme that will be STATIC defined https://github.com/evalica/bootswatch/blob/junco-themes/global/xwiki-colortheme.less  
13:03 <evalica> because right now I don't have the switching on the fly  
13:03 <vmassol> maybe you should use "Junco Theme" not just "Theme" which can be confused with color themes  
13:04 <vmassol> if that's what you mean by "theme  
13:04 <vmassol> "  
13:04 <evalica> every time I mean a ColorTheme I write it 'ColorTheme'  
13:04 <evalica> the others are Junco Themes  
13:04 <vmassol> ok… not clear when I read it  
13:05 <vmassol> I get it now though  
13:07 <vmassol> would be nice to have a theme that changes the layout to show the power  
13:07 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
13:07 <evalica> well you have Colibri vs. Blueberry  
13:07 <evalica> they have different mobile … breaking points :)  
13:08 <vmassol> layout is pretty much the same visually  
13:08 <vmassol> you mean the fact that they are centered?  
13:08 <vmassol> (for colibri)  
13:08 <vmassol> what if I wanted to have 4 columns for ex  
13:08 <evalica> the centering too  
13:08 <vmassol> is that part of the theme?  
13:09 <vmassol> what if I want a web site skin  
13:09 <vmassol> can I do that?  
13:09 <evalica> well… this is harder to do, because you don't have the HTML structure to do that  
13:09 <evalica> with the current templates  
13:09 <evalica> if you know CSS, you can do anything  
13:10 <vmassol> very nice extension btw :)  
13:11 <evalica> I'm curious if anyone has problems installing it  
13:12 <vmassol> you'll soon get feedback :)  
13:12 <evalica> thank you Vincent  
13:14 <vmassol> ahah nice junco skin doc in junco skin ;)  
13:17 <evalica> anyway I think the doc looks nicer in Junco :) http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Improvements/XWikiOrgJuncoHomepage/extensionDesktopLandscape.png  
13:30 <sburjan> vmassol: i built XE locally, and it seems I don't hit your issue anymore. But I still have one stacktrace: http://pastebin.com/kw6FAdvf  
13:34 <vmassol> sburjan: no idea about that maybe tmortagne has some idea  
13:48 <tmortagne> sburjan: I see what it is, in practice it's a minor issue, fixing it. Now we are talking about code that has has been introduced in 5.1 so I don't see why you have this issue only now  
13:49 <tmortagne> it's supposed to happen the fist time you modify the list of available translations in the admin  
13:50 <sburjan> I didn't modify anything  
13:50 <sburjan> maybe the DW did  
13:50 <tmortagne> hmm no it seems to be when you modify XWikiPreference for the first time  
13:50 <tmortagne> anyway, fixing it  
13:50 <vmassol> guys I propose to remove the 5.0 branch, wdyt?  
13:51 <vmassol> (following our rule of 2 branches we support anyway)  
13:53 <vmassol> we currently have 9 issues with a fixfor of 5.0.4 in platform FTR  
13:53 <vmassol> 3 in commons  
13:53 <vmassol> none in rendering  
13:54 <vmassol> and 1 in enterprise  
13:54 <ekarlso> is XW using bootstrap yet ?  
13:54 <vmassol> ekarlso: close, close, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Junco+Skin  
13:55 <vmassol> so it depends what you mean by XW  
13:55 <ekarlso> xwiki  
13:55 <vmassol> what is xwiki?  
13:55 <ekarlso> the wiki itself  
13:56 <vmassol> doesn't compute :)  
13:56 <vmassol> there's no such notion  
13:56 <vmassol> xwiki = set of extensions  
13:56 <ekarlso> hah, ok :p  
13:56 <vmassol> now  
13:56 <vmassol> if you talk about the default packaging of XE with the default bundled extensions  
13:56 <vmassol> then the answer is no  
13:57 <vmassol> :)  
13:57 <vmassol> said in another way  
13:57 <vmassol> the default bundled skin (colibri) is not using boostrap  
13:57 <ekarlso> ok :)  
13:58 <vmassol> the plan will probably be to include this new junco skin in XE in XWiki 6.0  
13:58 <vmassol> but notthing discussed yet  
14:03 <vmassol> (upgrading ci)  
14:11 <tmortagne> sburjan: should be fixed, thanks for the report  
14:12 <sburjan> tmortagne: no problem :)  
14:12 <sburjan> just increasing User Satisfaction :)  
14:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <vmassol> ok starting removal of 5.0 branch  
14:30 <ekarlso> why removing it ?  
14:31 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/thread/6edcf4t63uzrzb52  
14:46 <vmassol> I wonder why this profiles fails more on functional tests than without it  
14:48 <vmassol> maybe because the other job uses incremental build  
14:48 <vmassol> "Incremental build - only build changed modules"  
14:48 <ekarlso> why removing it ?  
14:48 <ekarlso> ehm, wrong place  
14:48 <vmassol> :)  
14:49 <vmassol> stuck in a loop? :)  
14:50 <vmassol> hmm lots of job failures now  
14:50 <vmassol> ah vnc issue  
14:51 <vmassol> restarting a3  
14:51 <vmassol> a6  
14:51 <vmassol> a4  
14:52 <vmassol> a1  
14:53 <vmassol> a13  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you verify that what I added is correct? http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HContainerAuthentication  
15:22 <vmassol> thanks  
15:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks good  
15:23 <vmassol> ok thank  
15:24 <tmortagne> it's not only Container technically but it's simpler like this  
15:24 <vmassol> yeah  
15:26 <sburjan> vmassol: you issue seems fixed also on Oracle  
15:26 <vmassol> great  
15:27 <vmassol> the new way cannot fail :)  
15:27 <sburjan> but again, I did not test on MySQl :)
